alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:06PM EST until January 12 at 3:24PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River near Wilmington. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding will affect low lying neighborhoods from Wilmington through Tewksbury to Lawrence. This includes a portion of Route 114 in Lawrence. Areas subject to basement flooding should move valuables to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Wednesday was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1115 AM EST.
